intro: Pityrodia viscida, commonly known as the sticky pityrodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and sticky, glandular leaves. It typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Pityrodia viscida is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
